title: ASC Port Autonome
text:
Union Culturelle et Sportive des Travailleurs Port Autonome is a <a href="Senegal">Senegal</a>ese <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> club based in <a href="Dakar">Dakar</a>. Their home stadium is <a href="Stade%20Port%20Autonome">Stade Port Autonome</a>. The club is named after the city and country's main shipping port the <a href="Autonomous%20Port%20of%20Dakar">Autonomous Port of Dakar</a>, it is also the ninth-busiest port in Africa.
Port Autonome also is ninth in the <a href="List%20of%20football%20clubs%20in%20Senegal%20by%20major%20honours%20won">number of major honours won</a> in Senegal numbering five, shared with <a href="ASC%20Lingu%C3%A8re">ASC Linguère</a> of Saint-Louis and <a href="Diambars%20FC">Djambars FC</a>.
History.
Their first title was won in 1990 and won their second straight in 1991. Their third and recent was in 2005. Port Autonome's first cup final appearance was in 1990 and faced <a href="ASC%20Lingu%C3%A8re">ASC Linguère</a> and lost 1–0. Their first and only cup title was won in 2000 after defeating <a href="ASC%20Saloum">ASC Saloum</a> of Kaolack 4–0; this was Port Autonome's recent cup final appearance. Also in the same year they won their only Assemblée Nationale Cup.
The club was relegated in the 2010 season to the Senegal Ligue 2. They returned again to Ligue 1 in 2013 and remained until they were relegated in the 2014–15 season after finishing last with 20 points, eight behind <a href="AS%20Pikine">AS Pikine</a> and with 14 losses.
Port Autonome's first appearance in the League Cup was in 2009. The club advanced up to the quarterfinals and lost to <a href="AS%20Douanes%20%28Dakar%29">AS Douanes</a> 2–0. In the <a href="2010%20League%20Cup">2010 edition</a>, the club advanced up to the semis and lost to <a href="ASC%20Diaraf">ASC Diaraf</a> 2–0. For a short time in late 2013, <a href="Casa%20Sport">Casa Sport</a> shared the number of honors won with Port Autonome; up to that time, Porto Autonome was ranked eighth.
